Trial_Design.evidence: Ninety subjects who underwent TKA were randomly assigned

Intervention.evidence: randomly assigned to receive ultrasound-guided CACB using either the OA or BA

Objective.evidence: In this study, the authors first applied the oblique approach (OA) to CACB and systematically compared the postoperative analgesic effects and adverse reactions of these two CACB methods

Method_Outcome.evidence: The main outcome measured was the exercise maximum visual analog scale (VAS) score at 72 h after surgery

Number_Randomised.evidence: Ninety subjects who underwent TKA were randomly assigned

Result_Outcome.evidence: postoperative exercise VAS and the incidence of postoperative adverse effects were lower in the OA group compared to the BA group

Harms.evidence: the incidence of postoperative adverse effects were lower in the OA group compared to the BA group

Trial_Registration.evidence: Trial Registration: Chinese Clinical Trial Registry: ChiCTR2200059889
